Food Service will begin serving Summer Meal Service -
W. C. Holland, Superintendent of ACPS, announces that our Food Service will begin our summer meal service next Monday, July 13, from 5:30 p.m. to 6:30 p.m. at five of our school locations. Meal pickups will also take place on Wednesdays at the same times and locations. Service will be drive-up style, and you must get out of your vehicles to pick up meals from the serving tables. Serving sites will include Chincoteague Elementary School, Arcadia High School, Metompkin Elementary School, Nandua Middle School, and Tangier Combined School. On Mondays, we will serve four meals (Two Breakfasts & Two Lunches), and on Wednesdays, we will serve six meals (Three Breakfasts & Three Lunches). ALL STUDENTS 18 OR YOUNGER ARE ELIGIBLE FOR MEAL PICKUP. KIDS DO NOT NEED TO BE ENROLLED IN ACCOMACK COUNTY TO PARTICIPATE! We look forward to seeing you! If you have any questions, call Brandyn Burkholder at the Food Service Department at 757-854-1519. http://edne.tw/n647445

Sincerely,

Coronavirus Information for Parents -
Dear Parent or Guardian:

Attached to this letter, we have provided the Coronavirus Fact Sheet from the CDC. To prevent widespread flu in the school, we recommend that your child stay home from school if experiencing flu or cold symptoms. To decide whether or not to send your child to school, please consider the following guidelines.

Keep your child at home for treatment and observation if he or she has any of the following symptoms:
● Fever‐greater than 100°F (A child who has a fever should remain at home until they are “fever free” for a minimum of 24 hours without tylenol or ibuprofen.)
● Vomiting
● Diarrhea
● General malaise or feelings of fatigue, discomfort, weakness or muscle aches
● Frequent congested (wet) or croup cough
● Lots of nasal congestion with frequent blowing of nose

(..continued) http://edne.tw/n615756

ACPS Child Check Developmental Screening -
Have you heard about Child Check? Child Check is a free developmental screening provided by Accomack County Schools for young children, birth to school age, whose parents are residents of Accomack County. This includes children attending ACPS or private schools and those who are home-schooled.

Children are screened by a team of professionals which includes a school psychologist, early childhood special education teacher, speech and language pathologist, and school nurse. Spanish and Creole interpreters are available.

If you have a young child who seems to be meeting developmental milestones at a slow rate, you may want to bring them to Child Check. This free screening can assure you that your child is developing normally or it can ensure that a child in need of special services receives them as soon as possible. Child Check will be held on Wednesday, March 25th at Accawmacke Elementary School at 3:30 p.m. To make an appointment for your child, call the Special Education Office at 824-3360 http://edne.tw/n612831
